text: Making the Ark of the Covenant
And Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood, two and a half cubits its length and a cubit and a half its width and a cubit and a half its height.
And he overlaid it \add with\add* pure gold inside and outside, and he made for it a gold molding all around.
And he cast for it four gold rings on its four feet; and two rings were on its one side, and two rings were on its second side.
And he made poles of acacia wood, and he overlaid them \add with\add* gold.
And he put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark to carry the ark.
And he made an atonement cover of pure gold, two and a half cubits its length and a cubit and a half its width.
And he made two cherubim of gold; he made them of hammered work at the two ends of the atonement cover.

One cherub \add was\add* ⸤at one end⸥,\f + \fr 37:8 \ft Literally “from end from this” \f* and one cherub \add was\add* ⸤at the other end⸥\f + \fr 37:8 \ft Literally “from end from this” \f* of the atonement cover; he made the cherubim at its two ends.

And the cherubim were \add with\add* outspread wings above, covering with their wings over the atonement cover ⸤and facing each other⸥;\f + \fr 37:9 \ft Literally “and their faces a man to his brother” \f* the faces of the cherubim were toward the atonement cover.
Making the Table and the Lampstand
And he made the table of acacia wood, two cubits its length and a cubit its width and a cubit and a half its height.
And he overlaid it \add with\add* pure gold, and he made for it a gold molding all around.
And he made for it a handbreadth rim all around, and he made a gold molding for its rim all around.
And he cast for it four gold rings, and he put the rings on the four corners where its four ⸤legs⸥\f + \fr 37:13 \ft Literally “feet” \f* \add were\add*.
The rings were near the rim as ⸤holders⸥\f + \fr 37:14 \ft Literally “houses” \f* for the poles to carry the table.
And he made the poles of acacia wood, and he overlaid them \add with\add* gold to carry the table.

And he made the vessels that \add were\add* on the table—its plates and its ladles,\f + \fr 37:16 \ft Or “bowls” \f* and its bowls and its pitchers with which \add libations\add* were poured—\add of\add* pure gold.

And he made the lampstand of pure gold; he made the lampstand of hammered work—its base and its branch, its cups, its buds, and its blossoms were ⸤all part of it⸥.\f + \fr 37:17 \ft Literally “from it” \f*
And six branches \add were\add* going out from its sides, three branches of the lampstand from its one side and three branches of the lampstand from its second side.

Three almond-flower cups \add were\add* on the one branch \add with\add* a bud and a blossom, and three almond-flower cups \add were\add* on the one branch \add with\add* a bud and a blossom—likewise for the six branches going out from the lampstand.
And on the lampstand \add were\add* four almond-flower cups, \add with\add* its\f + \fr 37:20 \ft Refers to the lampstand \f* buds and its blossoms.

And a bud \add was\add* under the two branches \add that came\add* from it, and a bud under the two branches from it, and a bud under the two branches from it, \add likewise\add* for the six branches coming out from the lampstand.
Their buds and their branches were from it, all of it one \add piece\add* of pure gold, hammered work.
And he made its seven lamps and its snuffers and its fire pans of pure gold.
He made it \add from\add* a talent of pure gold and all its \add pieces of\add* equipment.
Making the Incense Altar and Anointing Oil

And he made the incense altar of acacia wood, a cubit its length and a cubit its width—a square—and two cubits its height; its horns were ⸤of one piece with it⸥.\f + \fr 37:25 \ft Literally “from it” \f*
And he overlaid it \add with\add* pure gold—its top and its sides all around and its horns—and he made for it a gold molding all around.

And he made for it two gold rings under its molding ⸤on two opposite sides⸥\f + \fr 37:27 \ft Literally “on two of its sides on two of its sides” \f* as ⸤holders⸥\f + \fr 37:27 \ft Literally “houses” \f* for poles to carry it with them.
And he made the poles of acacia wood, and he overlaid them with gold.
And he made the holy anointing oil and the pure fragrant incense—work of a perfumer.
